description: The James Bond actor pleaded guilty to stepping off a trail in a thermal area during a visit to Yellowstone. He was fined $500 and ordered to donate $1,000 to a nonprofit that supports the park.
title: Pierce Brosnan is fined for leaving trail in Yellowstone National Park thermal area

description: Overall, the number of individual titles challenged in both school and public libraries spiked by 65% — the highest level ever recorded by the ALA.
title: American Library Association report says book challenges soared in 2023

description: The three iconic words remain the motto of the U.S. military academy. But an update to its mission statement, where the words had appeared for 26 years, has sparked outrage among conservatives online.
title: West Point axed 'duty, honor, country' from its mission statement. Conservatives fumed

description: They said a delay would ensure that Trump's legal team has sufficient time to review a new tranche of materials in the case. Jury selection is scheduled to begin March 25.
title: Manhattan prosecutor open to a 30-day delay in Trump's criminal trial

description: Former President Donald Trump has already said he would block the deal between U.S. Steel and its Japanese rival. Now President Biden is speaking out about it, too.
title: Biden opposes Nippon Steel takeover of U.S. Steel. It's an issue in some swing states

description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul went to Long Island to announce that the turbines are delivering clean power to the local electric grid, flipping a massive light switch to "turn on the future."
title: 35 miles east of Long Island, the U.S. has its first large offshore wind farm

description: Severe thunderstorms Wednesday evening produced huge chunks of hail in parts of Missouri and Kansas. "Gorilla hail" can create lots of damage and even has the potential to be fatal.
title: Baseball-sized 'gorilla hail' hits Kansas and Missouri during severe storms

description: Peter Pomerantsev co-founded a project recording Russian atrocities in Ukraine to combat Russian disinformation. His new book profiles a WWII propagandist who targeted the Nazi regime.
title: 'How to Win an Information War' details fighting with — and against — propaganda

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-NY, called for new elections in Israel as the country continues its war with Hamas.
title: Chuck Schumer calls for new elections in Israel, breaking with Benjamin Netanyahu

description: Mnuchin said he's in touch with other investors to try to buy the popular social media app as lawmakers are seeking to force its Chinese owners to sell the business.
title: Former Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin says he's interested in buying TikTok

description: A humanitarian ship is piloting a new sea route to bring food to Gaza to help avert famine after five months of war and Israeli restrictions on aid.
title: An aid ship is en route to Gaza, in a test of a sea corridor for the war-torn enclave

description: Haitians describe "desolation" and "dread" as plans for a transitional government are tested. The EU has approved the first comprehensive framework for regulating AI.
title: Haiti's political transition faces challenges; EU approves AI regulation legislation

description: The country's supreme court has temporarily banned Patanjali, a leading maker of ayurvedic products with ties to the prime minister, from advertising certain items due to a history of false claims.
title: Indian judge says billion-dollar ayurvedic company has taken the public 'for a ride'

description: Derived from hemp, it has similar effects to delta-9 THC, the main intoxicant in marijuana. It's fueling a rise in calls to poison control.
title: Delta-8, an unregulated form of THC, is popular among high school students

description: Waymo, part of Google's parent company, is responsible for the latest ride-share option. It started driving robotaxis in San Francisco last year. It also has them in Phoenix.
title: Waymo's robotaxi service set to expand into Los Angeles

description: Six artificial food dyes and titanium dioxide would be banned in schools under a proposal in the state legislature. Critics say there isn't enough evidence to prove they're a health risk.
title: Here are the concerns with artificial food dyes, as California weighs a ban in schools

description: As burned properties come up for sale in Lahaina, many worry outside developers will scoop them up. Some are turning to a tool that's helped other towns after a disaster: a community land trust.
title: After the fires, a Maui community tries a novel approach to keep homes in local hands

description: To those who have watched how certain elements of the anti-abortion campaign have gone from fringe to mainstream, the Alabama IVF decision is both validation and a warning of more shifts to come.
title: How 'fetal personhood' in Alabama's IVF ruling evolved from fringe to mainstream

description: National security officials have long warned about the dangers TikTok poses as long as it is owned by a Chinese company, but the threat remains theoretical.
title: The House passed a TikTok ban bill. But is the app really a national security threat?

description: At a time when colorectal cancer is rising, researchers say a blood test can detect 83% of people with the disease. If the FDA approves it the test would be another screening tool for early detection.
title: A simple blood test can detect colorectal cancer early, study finds

description: A lightly regarded Portuguese political party finds itself in a position to play kingmaker in the wake of national elections that failed to propel either of the two establishment parties into power.
title: In Portugal, an election results in uncertainty and the rise of the far right

description: One of the most pro-Palestinian nations in the world is not an Arab or Muslim country. It's not even in the Middle East. Polls show Ireland has some of the highest support for the Palestinians.
title: Why Ireland is one of the most pro-Palestinian nations in the world

description:
In 2011, the world was shaken by the Arab Spring, a wave of "pro-democracy" protests that spread throughout the Middle East and North Africa. The effects of the uprisings reverberated around the world as regimes fell in some countries, and civil war began in others. This week, we revisit the years leading up to the Arab Spring and its lasting impact on three people who lived through it.

To access bonus episodes and listen to Throughline sponsor-free, subscribe to Throughline+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org/throughline.
title: A Symphony of Resistance (Throwback)

description: Vice President Harris is planning to tour a Minnesota abortion clinic during a trip to the Twin Cities on Thursday. It's believed to be a first for a vice president or president.
title: Harris will visit an abortion clinic, a first for any president or vice president
